author: Leicester Mercury
title: Leicester Mercury published Tiling giant launches £2 million office revamp
text:
Comments (0) 
Topps Tiles is planning a £2 million overhaul of its Leicestershire head office. 
The investment will see a complete redesign and refurbishment of the Grove Park offices, with work getting under way in the new year. 
The revamp, which will be completed around next May or June, will see the building modernised, with a speciality product lab, team zones and work areas. 
Social spaces, an outside area and meeting rooms will also be refreshed. 
Air conditioning, heating and lighting are also being updated. 
Read more: Record sales push Topps Tiles profits up 10 per cent 
It comes as Topps Tiles also unveils a new careers website, and embarks on an accelerated store opening plan – with plans to take the total number of UK stores from 350 to 450 by 2021. 
Chief executive Matthew Williams said: "We are about to enter into a project which will see us completely refurbish the Grove Park offices. 
"There will be a bit of disruption while the work is being done, but there's genuine excitement about what we are going to create in terms of the new office environment." 
Topps Tiles has been based there for 12 years, and has 270 staff on site, split between the office and a big warehouse. 
Mr Williams said: "It's a big transformation and we will certainly be using our products because one of the key wishes is to have the offices dripping with product, really bringing it to life." 
Read more: Topps Tiles chief executive feeling positive post-Brexit vote 
Topps finance director Rob Parker said the business relocated its finance team to Grove Park from Manchester a year ago so all the company's central functions are now under one roof. 
Director of property Dan Little said: "This is a very exciting time for Topps Tiles, and we are delighted to be able to enhance our plans for growth with work on our new look headquarters. 
"The refurbishment will offer our employees a much more contemporary and creative space to work in, ensuring we can always retain our title of being the UK's number one tile specialist." 
Gareth Costello is associate director of building services consultants BSD, in Highcross Street, Leicester, which has been working on the plans for updating the services such as lighting and heating. 
He said: "Topps understands the value of an inspiring workspace. 
"The new office will provide the staff with an energy efficient, open, flexible working environment and BSD have been pleased to be a part of that journey." 
Last week, Topps Tiles reported that record sales pushed profits up by 10 per cent to £22 million in the year to October 1. 
Total sales were £215 million, 1.3 per cent up on last year. 
Topps is introducing a new careers website to support the growth of the business across the UK, mainly through the new store openings. 
Mark Taylor, head of human resources said: "The careers website is our shop window for a career at Topps Tiles. 
"We wanted to showcase the great culture and benefits of joining Topps Tiles to potential candidates through a modern and engaging careers website. 
"The 'Topps story' is told by our colleagues who are happy to showcase why Topps is a great place to work."
